xxl.core.pipes.sources
Class AbstractTimeStampSource<O,O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sources.AbstractSource<O2>
          xxl.core.pipes.sources.AbstractTimeStampSource<O,O2>
Type Parameters:
O - type of the value of the elements
O2 - type of the implementation of TimeStampedObject
All Implemented Interfaces:
Heartbeat, Node, Source<O2>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractTemporalSource
public abstract class AbstractTimeStampSource<O,O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>
extends AbstractSource<O2>
implements Heartbeat

Superclass for sources that transfer TimeStampedObjects, i.e., the transferred elements consist of a value and a time stamp.

Constructor Detail

AbstractTimeStampSource

public AbstractTimeStampSource()
Helps to create a new autonomous initial source in a query graph. Transfers the source's elements as fast as possible, i.e., the attribute period of a SourceProcessor is set to 0. The output rate is not measured.

AbstractTimeStampSource

public AbstractTimeStampSource(long period)
Helps to create a new autonomous initial source in a query graph. Creates a new instance of the class SourceProcessor using the given period.

Parameters:
period - The constant period of time between two transferred successive elements.

AbstractTimeStampSource

public AbstractTimeStampSource(SourceProcessor processor)
Helps to create a new autonomous initial source in a query graph.

Parameters:
processor - The thread simulating this source's activity.
Method Detail

subscribe

public boolean subscribe(Sink<? super O2> sink,
                         int sinkID)
                  throws SourceIsClosedException
Description copied from interface: Source
Subscribes the specified sink with the given ID to this source. The ID is necessary to distinguish different sources when using operators based on multiple inputs.
The sink and its corresponding ID have to be stored in an internal datastructure by this source and each sink can be accessed by an index.

Specified by:
subscribe in interface Source<O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>
Overrides:
subscribe in class AbstractSource<O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>
Parameters:
sink - The sink to be subscribed.
sinkID - The ID which will be passed when transfering a new object to the specified sink.
Returns:
Returns true, if the subscribe operation has been successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

unsubscribe

public boolean unsubscribe(Sink<? super O2> sink,
                           int sinkID)
                    throws SourceIsClosedException
Description copied from interface: Source
The given sink cancels its subscription. The registered sink with the given ID will not be informed about new elements any longer. If a sink is subscribed plurally, i.e. the same sink is subscribed with different IDs, only the subscription concerning the specified ID will be removed.

Specified by:
unsubscribe in interface Source<O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>
Overrides:
unsubscribe in class AbstractSource<O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>
Parameters:
sink - The sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
sinkID - The ID of the sink whose subscription is to be cancelled.
Returns:
Returns true, if the unsubscribe operation was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
SourceIsClosedException - If the source has already been closed.

heartbeat

public void heartbeat(long timeStamp,
                      int sourceID)
Description copied from interface: Heartbeat
This method accepts a heartbeat(the timestamp) from the source with the given id.

Specified by:
heartbeat in interface Heartbeat
Parameters:
timeStamp - the heartbeat.
sourceID - the source id from the source that deliverd the heartbeat.

transferHeartbeat

protected void transferHeartbeat(long timeStamp)
Calls the heartBeat method for all subscribed sinks with the given timestamp.

Parameters:
timeStamp - timestamp to transfer

activateHeartbeats

public void activateHeartbeats(boolean on)
Specified by:
activateHeartbeats in interface Heartbeat

transfer

public void transfer(O2 o)
Description copied from class: AbstractSource
Transfers the given element to all subscribed sinks. The process method is invoked for each of these sinks with the element to be transferred and the ID the corresponding sink initially specified during its subscription.
Additionally, this method measures the outputRate if measureOutputRate is set.

Specified by:
transfer in interface Source<O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>
Overrides:
transfer in class AbstractSource<O2 extends TimeStampedObject<O>>
Parameters:
o - The element to be transferred.
